features.description: A feature film about this site was made in 2015. Information about that film is available at http://www.imdb.com/title/tt4481412/

features.web_link_hover: Francisco de Chicora, 16th Century Native of Winyah Bay
features.description: Francisco de Chicora was a 16th-century Native American captive, whose personal history is connected to Winyah Bay. His enslavement to the powerful Spainard Lucas Vázquez de Ayllón led to his descriptions of coastal South Carolina having a profound effect on the imagination of the Spanish court.
Information about the Catawba Cultural Center, located on the tribal reservation. More information about the Catawba can be found at: http://www.scencyclopedia.org/sce/entries/catawbas/
A guide to an interpretive hiking trail around the Sewee Shell Ring in the Francis Marion and Sumter National Forests.

The Coastal Discovery Museum, a Lowcountry-focused affiliate of the Smithsonian, located on Hilton Head Island.

The Charleston Museum, located in downtown Charleston, preserves the history and culture of Charleston and the Lowcountry in a variety of perspectives. Information about their new Native American exhibits can be found at: https://www.charlestonmuseum.org/news-events/new-native-american-exhibits-in/
Information about a planned public park that explores the natural and cultural history of the Midlands of South Carolina

features.web_link_hover: The Discovery of Old Fort Congaree
